original_title: Passenger ships between India and Sri Lanka to commence from end of April
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation said passenger ships between India and Sri Lanka will commence from the end of April.
Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva said a passenger terminal is being built at the Kankesanturai harbor for this purpose.
The subject Minister said talks were held with relevant officials last week, and India expressed willingness to allow such vessels to leave and dock at Indian ports.

Minister de Silva said owners of vessels can carry passengers if they can maintain the vessels up to standard according to international maritime law, and obtain approval from the Indian government as well.
